Collect 10 ml water sample with Thio Bag (or bottle).
Avoid touching the inside of the Thio Bag, lid or bottle.
Open growth medium sachet and add powder medium or test bud straight to the sample from the sachet
Powder medium: Dissolve medium in sample for a few minutes. Gently swirl the bag several times until the medium is completely dissolved.
Test bud: Dissolve medium in sample for 10 – 12 minutes maximum by periodically swirling the bottle or squeezing the test bud in the Thio Bag to promote release of the medium from its plastic carrier
When medium is completely dissolved, the water sample turns yellow.
When using a test bud, leave it in the Thio Bag or bottle while pouring.
Prepare the work area and put on plastic gloves.
Collect 100 ml water sample with bottle or Thio Bag.
Label bag and/or attach barcode asset tag to compartment bag.
Tear off perforated seam at top of the bag.
Rub sides at the top of each compartment to open the bag, use the white tabs at top of the bag to keep the bag open while pouring.
Slowly pour sample into bag while gently tilting and squeezing bag to distribute sample amongst five compartments.
Fill evenly across bag to the black fill line.
Attach seal clip across the bag above the fill line and below the compartment top openings.
Snap rod-shaped part of the clip from other side of bag into U-shape to lock in place across the bag.
After attaching clip, bag can be kept vertical or horizontal.
Close the top of the bag with the yellow Whirl-Pak seal and then roll down the bag toward the seal clip (step 1) and fold the yellow ends (step 2).
Let the sample incubate, depending on the ambient temperature:
Take photo of the incubated sample.
In the next screen, change the colours in the interface to match the colours of the sample in the bag compartments.
Click the compartments to change colour.
NOTE: Any trace of blue or blue/green in a compartment indicates presence of E. coli, even just specks of blue/blue green color or just blue/blue green sediment at the bottom of a compartment.
Add 1–2 mL of liquid bleach (NaOCl) or sufficient free chlorine tablets (calcium hypochlorite or sodium dichloroisocyanurate) to provide about 100 milligrams of free chlorine.
After 45 minutes, pour contents into a sink, toilet or hole in ground and safely dispose the empty compartment bag.
Retain plastic seal clip for reuse.
Add 90 ml of distilled water to the water sample.

Incubate in a portable incubator, preferably at 35 – 37 °C for 48 hours or put in or near another heat source.

In addition to portable incubators, samples can be maintained at 25°C to 44.5°C using: thermal coolers/bags; proximity to heat sources for humans and food; poultry or reptile incubator, or near refrigerator coils or room heating vents.
Dissolve medium in sample for a few minutes maximum by periodically swirling the bottle or squeezing the test bud in the Thio Bag to promote release of the medium from its plastic carrier
Take a photo of the incubated sample while shining with a UV light (365 nm) on the compartment bag in a dark environment.

NOTE: Compartments positive for E. coli are automatically also positive for Total Coliform and greyed out in the next interface. Remember to shine a UV light to observe the fluorescent blue colour (positive for Total Coliform).
